articles.title: Asian stocks slump, dollar shines as inflation fears flare - Reuters
articles.description: Inflation fears pressured Asian stocks and buoyed the dollar on Thursday after data overnight showed U.S. consumer prices surged at the fastest pace since 1990 last month, boosting the case for faster Federal Reserve policy tightening.
articles.content: TV camera men wait for the opening of market in front of a large screen showing stock prices at the Tokyo Stock Exchange in Tokyo, Japan October 2, 2020. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-HoonTOKYO, Nov 11 (Reuters)… [+3819 chars]

articles.title: Duterte expected to tackle COVID-19 pandemic, climate change in APEC meet - CNN Philippines
articles.description: President Rodrigo Duterte is expected to push the country's stance on challenges brought by the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change when he attends the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting slated this week.

articles.title: African lion at Singapore Zoo is fifth lion to test positive for Covid-19, other lions to be tested - TODAY
articles.description: SINGAPORE — An African lion at the Singapore Zoo has tested positive for Covid-19, a day after four Asiatic lions at the Night Safari contracted the virus, the Animal and Veterinary Service (AVS) said.

articles.title: Stocks end 6-day rally as investors take profits - BusinessWorld Online
articles.description: THE PHILIPPINE stock market ended its six-day rally on Wednesday, in line with other Asian markets that declined after the Chinese government reported a spike in inflation in October.

articles.title: Singapore teen cheated victims by posing as a woman online offering sex services - The Star Online
articles.description: SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): Less than two weeks after he was put on probation for other offences, a 17-year-old boy posed as a woman online offering sexual services to cheat men into paying him.
